item.title: Lorie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lorie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lorie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lorie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lorie add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "He's like a drug for you, Bella." -- Stephenie Meyer

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Lorie add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "My rapier wit hides my inner pain." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Cassandra Clare
Lorie add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Is this the part where you start tearing off strips of your shirt to bind my wounds?" "If you wanted me to rip my clothes off, you should have just asked." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Declarations of love amuse me. Especially when unrequited." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Is this the part where you say if I hurt her, you'll kill me?" "No" Simon said, "If you hurt Clary she's quite capable of killing you herself. Possibly with a variety of weapons." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "Just because you call an electric eel a rubber duck doesn't make it a rubber duck, does it? And God help the poor bastard who decides they want to take a bath with the duckie. (Jace Wayland)" -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "Right now I'd like all my troubles to stand in front of me in a straight line, and one by one I'd give each a black eye. " -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "... If we don't tell strange stories, when something strange happens we won't believe it." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "All I've ever wanted was to be near you." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "People have a habit of inventing fictions they will believe wholeheartedly in order to ignore the truth they cannot accept." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "I know because I read...Your mind is not a cage. It's a garden. And it requires cultivating." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "I run after her, not really giving chase. Iâ€™m running because I can, because I must. Because I want to see how far I can go before I have to stop." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "There are no safe choices. Only other choices." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "Power changes everything till it is difficult to say who are the heroes and who the villains." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "But we can't go back. We can only go forward." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "Eve didn't choose to eat the apple. She was tempted by the serpent." "Yes," I argue, thoughts coming out half-formed. "But...she didn't have to take a bite. She chose to." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "We're all strangers connected by what we reveal, what we share, what we take away--our stories. I guess that's what I love about books--they are thin strands of humanity that tether us to one another for a small bit of time, that make us feel less alone or even more comfortable with our aloneness, if need be." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "You must remember, my dear lady, the most important rule of any successful illusion: First, the people must want to believe in it." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "Reminds us that greatness lies even in the smallest of moments, in the humblest of hearts, and we shall, each of us, be called to greatness. Whether we shall rise to meet it or let it slip away is the challenge put before us all." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "And that is how change happens. One gesture. One person. One moment at a time." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "I wish to live for myself. I should never want to be trapped." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "It's knowing I'll never have what she has--a beauty so powerful it brings things to you. I fear I will always have to chase things I want. I'll always have to wonder whether I'm truly wanted or whether I've just been settled for." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Lorie add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "We create the illusions we need to go on." -- Libba Bray
